CITY COUNCIL
REGULAR MEETING
FEBRUARY 26, 2024
5:30 PM
SULLIVAN CHAMBER

~FINAL ACTIONS~
MEETING

Monday, February 26, 2024

TIME

5:30 PM

PRESIDING OFFICER

Mayor E. Denise Simmons

1. Minutes of the City Council - Regular Meeting – February 12, 2024 5:30 PM

RESULT:
ACCEPTED AND PLACED ON FILE [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor Wilson, Mayor Simmons

ABSENT:

Councillor Azeem


PAGE 1

Feb 26, 2024

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of
$300,000 from Free Cash to the General Fund Law Department Other Ordinary Maintenance account.
The funds will be used to cover unanticipated increases in costs relating to legal matters handled by
outside counsel legal services, stenographers and court reporters, constable services, consultants and
experts, temporary contract attorneys covering while staff was on parental leaves, as well as filing
fees and related costs in matters pending in courts and/or administrative bodies. These were necessary
expenses used to manage litigation and other important legal matters essential to the City of
Cambridge.
CMA 2024 #23
RESULT:
APPROPRIATION ADOPTED CMA PLACED ON FILE [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor Wilson, Mayor Simmons

ABSENT:

Councillor Azeem

2. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to appointments and
reappointments of members to the Cambridge Bicycle Committee for a term of two years, effective
February 26, 2024.
CMA 2024 #24
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor Wilson, Mayor Simmons

ABSENT:

Councillor Azeem

3. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative appointments and
reappointments of members to the Cambridge Pedestrian Committee.
CMA 2024 #25
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor Wilson, Mayor Simmons

ABSENT:

Councillor Azeem


PAGE 2

Feb 26, 2024

4. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, Policy Order Response #24-15
dated February 12, 2024 regarding drafting zoning language and related changes to allow for and
encourage the continued growth, redevelopment, and evolution of Central Square.
CMA 2024 #26
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor Wilson, Mayor Simmons

ABSENT:

Councillor Azeem

5. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the establishment of a
revolving fund for the Department of Human Service Programs (DHSP).
CMA 2024 #27
RESULT:
REFERRED TO ORDINANCE COMMITTEE [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor Wilson, Mayor Simmons

ABSENT:

Councillor Azeem


PAGE 3

Feb 26, 2024

II. CALENDAR

CHARTER RIGHT
1. That the Final Report of the Charter Review Committee be referred to the Government
Operations, Rules and Claims Committee.
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY MAYOR SIMMONS
IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 12, 2024
POR 2024 #19
Councillor Toner
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AND REFERRED TO THE GOVERNMENT
OPERATIONS, RULES AND CLAIMS COMMITTEE [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor Wilson, Mayor
Simmons

ABSENT:

Councillor Azeem

UNFINISHED BUSINESS
2. A communication was received from Kathleen Born, Charter Review Committee Chair,
transmitting the Final Report of the Charter Review Committee. Please note that this report was
received by the City Clerk on January 31, 2024.
COF 2024 #11
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor Wilson, Mayor
Simmons

ABSENT:

Councillor Azeem


PAGE 4

Feb 26, 2024

3. An Ordinance 2023 #8B has been received from City Clerk, relative to Amend Chapter 14.04 –
Fair Housing.
PASSED TO A SECOND READING IN COUNCIL OCTOBER 2, 2023.
FURTHER AMENDED IN COUNCIL NOVEMBER 6, 2023.
THIS ITEM WILL REMAIN ON UNFINISHED BUSINESS UNTIL THE STATE
LEGISLATURE APPROVES THE SPECIAL ACT THAT IS NEEDED BEFORE THIS
CAN BE ORDAINED
ORDD-2023-8B

RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 5

Next: 3/4/2024 5:30 PM

Feb 26, 2024

III. APPLICATIONS AND PETITIONS
1. An application was received from Edward Batten representing Retro Fitness, requesting permission
for a projecting sign at the premises numbered 822 Somerville Avenue, approval has been received
from Inspectional Services, Department of Public Works, Community Development Department and
proof of abutter mailing has been provided.
APP 2024 #6
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor Wilson, Mayor Simmons

ABSENT:

Councillor Azeem


PAGE 6

Feb 26, 2024

PAGE 17

Feb 26, 2024

5. Commending Dr. Beverly C. Sealey’s outstanding contributions to the Cambridge community.
Vice Mayor McGovern, Mayor Simmons, Councillor Wilson and entire membership.
RES 2024 #32
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor Wilson, Mayor Simmons

ABSENT:

Councillor Azeem

Councillor Azeem

Feb 26, 2024

VI. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. That the City Manager is requested to present recommendations for the refinement and improvement
of the housing permitting process to the City Council, with a focus on reducing delays, minimizing
costs, and enhancing clarity and accessibility for all stakeholders.
POR 2024 #20
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED AND REFERRED TO THE HOUSING
COMMITTEE [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor Wilson, Mayor Simmons

ABSENT:

Councillor Azeem

2. City Council support of H.4138, The Affordable Homes Act, and urge legislators to retain the
provisions for a local option transfer fee.
POR 2024 #21
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Mayor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [6-2-1]

YEAS:
Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor SobrinhoWheeler, Councillor Wilson, Mayor Simmons

NAYS:
Councillor Pickett, Councillor Toner

ABSENT:

Councillor Azeem

3. Declare April 19th, 2024 as Global Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia Awareness Day and Lighting
City Hall in Recognition.
POR 2024 #22
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Siddiqui, Mayor Simmons, Vice Mayor McGovern
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor Wilson, Mayor Simmons

ABSENT:

Councillor Azeem


PAGE 20

Feb 26, 2024

4. City Council recognition of International Mother Language Day every February 21st.
POR 2024 #23
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Wilson, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Mayor Simmons
RESULT:

YEAS:
Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor Wilson, Mayor Simmons

ABSENT:

Councillor Azeem

5. That the City Manager is hereby directed to confer with the City Manager’s Housing Liaison,
Community Development Department, and the Cambridge Housing Authority on the feasibility of
municipally-funded housing vouchers.
POR 2024 #24
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Azeem, Councillor Wilson
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED AND REFERRED TO THE HOUSING
COMMITTEE [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor Wilson, Mayor Simmons

ABSENT:

Councillor Azeem

in the Economic Feasibility Analysis provided to EOHLC as part of Cambridge’s MBTA
Communities final compliance submission.

Councillor Toner, Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan

AWAITING REPORT LIST

24-3.

Report back after conferring with relevant City departments on potential public
renewable energy projects that could receive funding through the IRA Direct Pay
provision.
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Wilson (O-3) from 1/22/2024

24-4.

Report on recommendations and legal opinions for adjusting transportation related
fees and other considered changes based on the conversations in committee on
December 6, 2023.
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Azeem (O-4) from 1/22/2024

24-5.

Report on the process of drafting updated district maps and development processes,
along with the zoning language and relevant ordinances to allow for and encourage
the continued growth, redevelopment, and evolution of Central Square.
(O-2) from

RESULT:
REPORT RECEIVED AND ACCEPTED

24-6.

Report on the research of rules and regulations governing the use of Electric
Micromobility Devices and what, if any, authority Cambridge has to introduce its
own regulations of these Devices including speed and location of use, and report back
to the City Council in a timely manner.
Councillor Pickett, Councillor Toner, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Wilson (O4) from 2/12/2024

24-7.

A report on a review of the Final Report of the Charter Review Committee and its
proposals and provide written feedback on the legality, and practicality of the
proposals in advance of future discussion.
Councillor Toner (O-5) from 2/12/2024

Feb 12, 2024

Packet Pg. 25

1

MINUTES OF THE
CAMBRIDGE CITY COUNCIL REGULAR MEETING
Monday, February 12, 2024

The Chair, Mayor Simmons asked the City Clerk to call the roll.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Present/In Person
Vice Mayor Marc C. McGovern – Present/In Person
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Present/In Person
Councillor Joan F. Pickett – Present/In Person
Councillor Jivan G. Sobrinho-Wheeler - Present/In Person
Councillor Sumbul Siddiqui – Present/In Person
Councillor Paul F. Toner – Present/In Person
Councillor Ayesha M. Wilson – Present/In Person
Mayor E. Denise Simmons – Present/In Person
Present-9. Quorum established.
The Chair, Mayor Simmons wished everyone a Happy Chinese New Year and reminded
everyone that we are in the midst of Black History Month.
PUBLIC COMMENT
The Chair, Mayor Simmons noted that public comment may be made in accordance with
Council Rules and MGL Chapter 30A, Section 20. Mayor Simmons also noted that the
meeting was being audio and video recorded by the City and could be being audio and
video recorded by members of the public. The Chair, Mayor Simmons noted that public
comment could be emailed to CityClerk@Cambridgema.gov. Mayor Simmons noted that
each person would get up to 2 minutes to speak.
The following individuals were recognized for public comment.
Itamar Turner-Trauring, 139 Oxford Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments regarding CMA
#11.
Gleb Bahmutov, 19 Winslow Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments regarding CMA #11.
Clyve Lawrence, 26 Plympton Street, Cambridge, MA, spoke on Policy Order #4.
Carolyn Fuller, 12 Douglass Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments regarding Policy Order
#4 and pedestrian safety.
1
Packet Pg. 26

Minutes Acceptance: Minutes of Feb 12, 2024 5:30 PM (Submission of the Record)

A Regular Meeting of the Cambridge City Council was held on Monday, February 12, 2024. The
meeting was called to order at 5:30 p.m. by the Honorable Mayor E. Denise Simmons. Pursuant
to Chapter 2 of the Acts of 2023, adopted by Massachusetts General Assembly and approved by
the Governor, this public meeting was fully remote with participation via Zoom.

1

Bill McAvinney, 12 Douglass Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments on Policy Order #4 and
pedestrian safety.
Robin Chase, 40 Cottage Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments of support to CMA #11 and
Policy Order #4.
Dan Eisner, 6 Bristol Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments relative to Calendar Item #1.
Carol Lee Rawn, 59 Larchwood Drive, Cambridge, MA, offered comments on CMA #11 and
Policy Order #4.
Faraz Alizadeh, 10 DeWolfe Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments on CMA #11 and Policy
Order #4.
Suzanne Blier, 5 Fuller Place, Cambridge, MA, offered comments of support for all the Policy
Orders on the Agenda.
Karl Schmeckpeper offered comments on CMA #11 and Policy Order #4.
John Pitkin, 18 Fayette Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments relative to CMA #11 and the
CSO report.
James Williamson, Churchill Avenue, Cambridge, MA, offered comments and suggestions on
Policy Order #4.
Thad Kerosky, 60 Pleasant Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments relative to Policy Order
#4.
Dan Totten, 54 Bishop Allen, Cambridge, MA, offered comments on HEART and the CSD
update, CMA #12.
Heather Hoffman, 213 Hurley Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments on Public Comment
signup, the Central Square proposal and housing, and Policy Order #4.
Robert Bledsoe, 180 Harvard Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments on Charter Right #1.
The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Councillor Siddiqui who made a motion to close
public comment. Mayor Simmons called for a voice vote. The motion passed and was
unanimous.
SUBMISSION OF THE RECORD
The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Councillor Toner who made a motion to accept the
minutes from the Regular City Council Meeting on January 29, 2024. Mayor Simmons
called for a voice vote. The motion passed and was unanimous.

2
Packet Pg. 27

Minutes Acceptance: Minutes of Feb 12, 2024 5:30 PM (Submission of the Record)

Joel Paul, 12 Moreland Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments on Policy Order #4.

1

The Chair, Mayor Simmons made a motion to adopt the City Manager’s Consent Agenda
that included CMA 2024 #11/Adopt Appropriation Order, CMA 2024 #12/Refer to
Housing Committee, CMA 2024 #13/Place on File, CMA 2024 #14/Adopt Appropriation
Order, CMA 2024 #15/Adopt Appropriation Order, CMA 2024 #16/Adopt Appropriation
Order, CMA 2024 #17/Adopt Appropriation Order, CMA 2024 #18/Adopt Appropriation
Order, and CMA 2024 #19/Adopt Appropriation Order.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Yes
Vice Mayor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor Joan F. Pickett – Yes
Councillor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Councillor Jivan G. Sobrinho-Wheeler – Yes
Councillor Paul F. Toner – Yes
Councillor Ayesha M. Wilson – Yes
Mayor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Yes-9. Motion passed.
CITY MANAGER’S NON-CONSENT AGENDA
The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Councillor Nolan and Councillor Siddiqui for
comments and questions on CMA 2024 #20, relative to Awaiting report Item Number 24-01
regarding Lesley University’s ARPA-funded training program with the City of Somerville.
Assistant City Manager Ellen Semonoff responded to Councillors.
The Chair, Mayor Simmons made a motion to place CMA 2024 #20 on file.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Yes
Vice Mayor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor Joan F. Pickett – Yes
Councillor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Councillor Jivan G. Sobrinho-Wheeler – Yes
Councillor Paul F. Toner – Yes
Councillor Ayesha M. Wilson – Yes
Mayor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Yes-9. Motion passed.
The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Councillors for comments and questions on CMA
2024 #21 relative to the Cycling Safety Ordinance (CSO) Economic Impact Report. Mayor
Simmons also shared comments on the matter. City Manager Huang, Deputy City Manager
O’Riordan and Assistant City Manager Farooq responded to comments and questions.
3
Packet Pg. 28

Minutes Acceptance: Minutes of Feb 12, 2024 5:30 PM (Submission of the Record)

CITY MANAGER’S CONSENT AGENDA

The Chair, Mayor Simmons noted that she looks forward to the discussion in the Economic
Development and University Relations Committee and made a motion to place CMA 2024
#21 on file. Mayor Simmons called for a voice vote. The motion passed and was
unanimous.
The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Councillor Toner on CMA 2024 #22 relative to a
Community Safety Department Update. Councillor Toner indicated that he pulled the item
because he wanted to hear an update. The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Director of the
Community Safety Department Elizabeth Speakman, who introduced members of the team and
gave an update. The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized the Councillors for comments and
questions. At approximately 7:36 p.m. Vice Mayor McGovern took the Chair and
acknowledged Councillors for additional comments and questions. City Manager Huang and
Director Speakman responded to comments and questions raised.
The Chair, Vice Mayor McGovern recognized Councillor Toner who made a motion to
place CMA 2024 #22 on file. Vice Mayor McGovern called for a voice vote. The motion
passed and was unanimous.
POLICY ORDERS
The Chair, Vice Mayor McGovern recognized Councillor Nolan who made a motion to
suspend the rules to bring forward POR 2024 #15, so that it could be addressed with the
City Manager and his team present. Vice Mayor McGovern called for a voice vote. The
motion passed and was unanimous.
The Chair, Vice Mayor McGovern recognized Councillor Azeem on CMA 2024 #15, That
the City Manager is requested to direct the Community Development Department to
commence the process of drafting updated district maps and development processes, along
with zoning language and relevant ordinances to allow for and encourage the continued
growth, redevelopment, and evolution of Central Square. Councillor Azeem spoke to the
intent of the policy order. The Chair, Vice Mayor McGovern also offered comments noting that
this is a response to the City Manager requesting that the Council provide direction. The Chair,
Vice Mayor McGovern recognized Councillor Nolan, Councillor Siddiqui, and Councillor Toner
for comments.
The Chair, Vice Mayor McGovern made a motion to adopt POR 2024 #15. Vice Mayor
McGovern called for a voice vote. The motion passed and was unanimous.
The Chair, Vice Mayor McGovern recognized Councillor Wilson who made a motion to
suspend the rules to bring forward POR 2024 #16, so that it could be addressed with the
City Manager and his team present. Vice Mayor McGovern called for a voice vote. The
motion passed and was unanimous.
The Chair, Vice Mayor McGovern recognized Councillor Wilson who spoke on the need
for POR 2024 #16, That the City Manager is requested to facilitate the participation in a
4
Packet Pg. 29

Minutes Acceptance: Minutes of Feb 12, 2024 5:30 PM (Submission of the Record)

1

1

The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Councillor Wilson who made a motion to suspend
the rules to bring forward POR 2024 #17, so that it could be addressed with the City
Manager and his team present. Mayor Simmons called for a voice vote. The motion passed
and was unanimous.
The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Councillor Pickett who spoke on the need for POR
2024 #17, That the City Manager request that the City Solicitor in collaboration with the
Commissioner of Traffic, Parking and Transportation, Community Development and the
Police Department research rules and regulations governing the use of Electric
Micromobility Devices and what, if any, authority Cambridge has to introduce its own
regulations of these Devices including speed and location of use, and report back to the
City council in a timely manner. The Chair, Mayor Simmons also recognized Councillor
Wilson, Councillor Nolan, and Councillor Azeem who spoke on the matter.
The Chair, Mayor Simmons made a motion to adopt POR 2024 #17. Mayor Simmons
called for a voice vote. The motion passed and was unanimous.
CALENDAR/CHARTER RIGHT
The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Councillor Siddiqui for comments on POR 2024
#13 on the handling of foreign policy matters in City Council. The Chair, Mayor Simmons
also recognized Councillor Azeem, Councillor Pickett, Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor
Toner, Councillor Nolan, and Councillor Wilson for comments. The Chair, Mayor Simmons
said that she found the most recent situation troubling and noted a difference between the
message and the messenger.
The Chair, Mayor Simmons made a motion to adopt POR 2024 #13 and refer it to the
Government Operations, Rules, and Claims Committee. Mayor Simmons called for a voice
vote. The motion passed and was unanimous.
APPLICATIONS
The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Vice Mayor McGovern who made a motion to
adopt the order for APP 2024 #5 for a curb cut at 36-138 Rindge Avenue. Mayor Simmons
called for a voice vote. The motion passed and was unanimous.

5
Packet Pg. 30

Minutes Acceptance: Minutes of Feb 12, 2024 5:30 PM (Submission of the Record)

public hearing(s) and or working session(s) to address Racial and Gender Disparities in
City contracting and procurement. The Chair, Vice Mayor McGovern also recognized
Councillor Siddiqui who spoke to the need for this work to be done. City Manager Huang
responded, noting some details of the procurement process. At approximately 8:00 p.m. Mayor
Simmons took the Chair and recognized Councillor Nolan and Councillor Toner who offered
comments. Mayor Simmons also offered comments.
The Chair, Mayor Simmons made a motion to adopt POR 2024 #16. Mayor Simmons
called for a voice vote. The motion passed and was unanimous.

1

COMMUNICATIONS
The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Vice Mayor McGovern who made a motion to
place all communications on file. Mayor Simmons called for a voice vote. The motion
passed.

The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Councillor Wilson who made a motion to adopt the
orders for Resolutions RES 2024 # 16 through RES 2024 # 26, making them unanimous
upon adoption. Mayor Simmons called for a voice vote. The motion passed and was
unanimous.
POLICY ORDERS
The Chair, Mayor Simmons recognized Councillor Toner who spoke on POR 2024 #14
relative to declaring March 2, 2024 Youth Hockey Day in Cambridge and made a motion to
adopt the order. Mayor Simmons called for a voice vote. The motion passed and was
unanimous.
